title: Find the Mean When Given the Z-score
question_text:
One of the values in a normal distribution is $37$ and its z-score is $-2.15$.
If the standard deviation of the distribution is $4.19$, what is the approximate mean of the distribution?
solution:
If $x$ is an observation from a normal distribution with a known mean and standard deviation, the z-score of $x$ is:

$$z=\dfrac { \text{x-mean }}{ \text{standard deviation} } $$

1) Substitute the values into the formula:

$$-2.15=\dfrac { 37-\mu }{ 4.19 }$$

2) Solve for the mean:

$$(4.19)\times -2.15=\dfrac { 37-\mu }{ 4.19 } \times (4.19)$$

$$ -9=37-\mu $$

$$ -46=-\mu $$

$$ 46=\mu $$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as both sides of the equation were not divided by $-1$.

Choice 'B' is incorrect as $37$ was added to both sides instead of being subtracted and both sides of the equation were not divided by $-1$.

Choice 'C' is incorrect as $37$ was added to both sides of the equation.

Choice 'D' is incorrect as $-2.15$ was divided by $4.19$ instead of being multiplied.
